3.1.1.title: Purpose
3.1.1.content:
The Blowout Preventer (BOP) system is the secondary well barrier:

**Primary Function:**
- Close the wellbore to stop uncontrolled flow
- Seal around drillpipe or on open hole
- Cut drillpipe if necessary
- Allow controlled circulation during well control

**Components:**
- Preventers (rams and annulars)
- Control system
- Choke and kill lines and manifolds
- Associated valves and instrumentation

**The BOP does not prevent kicks - it enables controlled response to kicks.**

3.1.2.title: Surface BOP Stack Configuration
3.1.2.content:
**Typical Configuration (bottom to top):**
1. Casing spool (mounted on wellhead)
2. Kill line outlet
3. Lower pipe rams
4. Blind/shear rams
5. Choke line outlet
6. Upper pipe rams
7. Annular preventer
8. Drilling spool or rotating head

**Minimum Requirements:**
- At least two pipe ram sets
- One blind or blind/shear ram
- One annular preventer
- Choke and kill line connections below ram

**Variations:**
Configuration varies by:
- Anticipated pressures
- Pipe sizes used
- Regulatory requirements
- Company standards

3.1.3.title: Subsea BOP Stack Configuration
3.1.3.content:
**LMRP (Lower Marine Riser Package):**
- Upper annular
- Lower annular
- Flex joint
- Riser connector
- LMRP connector
- Control pods and hot lines

**BOP Stack:**
- Blind shear rams
- Casing shear rams (some configurations)
- Multiple pipe ram sets
- Choke and kill outlets
- Wellhead connector

**Total Height:**
Subsea stacks can be 40-60 ft tall and weigh hundreds of tons.

**Control:**
- Multiplex (MUX) control system
- Dual control pods for redundancy
- Acoustic backup
- ROV intervention capability

3.1.4.title: Pressure Ratings
3.1.4.content:
**Common Ratings:**
- 5,000 psi (34.5 MPa)
- 10,000 psi (69 MPa)
- 15,000 psi (103 MPa)
- 20,000 psi (138 MPa)

**Rating Basis:**
- Working pressure at rated temperature
- Higher temperatures may derate pressure
- All components in stack must match rating

**Selection:**
BOP rating must exceed:
- Maximum anticipated surface pressure (MASP)
- Calculated based on formation pressure and wellbore geometry

**Verification:**
- Pressure tested to API/regulatory requirements
- Typically test to full rated working pressure initially
- Periodic tests to reduced percentage

3.1.5.title: Bore Size
3.1.5.content:
**Common Sizes:**
- 13-5/8" (surface and some subsea)
- 18-3/4" (common subsea)
- 21-1/4" (large bore subsea)

**Sizing:**
- Must accommodate all tools and casing to be run through
- Match to wellhead and casing program
- Larger bore = larger equipment

**Tool Joint Clearance:**
- Tool joints must pass through all rams
- Critical for stripping operations
- Know exact tool joint OD vs ram bore
